I asked that the city put in the iron covers (grates) , like there are on all the other trees on Summer Street, so that people could walk on the sidewalk and not be injured. Unfortunately the city removed the trees rather than put in well covers. My goal wasn't to have the trees removed, we need more trees in downtown Boston. But be that as it may. Now there are two empty trees pits and the color of the material in the pit is very like the color of the sidewalk so now many people are stepping into the tree pit and potentially hurting their ankles or knees. So can the city either put in new trees and use the iron covers to cover the tree wells, like the other trees on Summer St or fill in the tree pits so that people aren't potential hurting themselves. Thank you.

status_notes: Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) Inspector investigated and determined the following:. BWSC and National Grid are performing trench repairs left behind after the installation of new gas and water mains. The goal is to have those trenches be smooth and level when the job is done. The CIU acknowledges that the crew should not have had the compressor hose within the crosswalk.   We have spoken to the crew to make sure this does not happen again.  In addition if it is determined that wheelchairs cannot navigate the trench left down low awaiting the top course, we will have the contractor place sidewalk closed signs. . For any questions or concerns, please contact the number listed below. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

You stated "not in violation at this time"?
